required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Steroid Injection vs. BioDRestore for Patients With Knee OA
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized Study Comparing Steroid Injection and BioDRestore for Patients With Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This study will include patients who are diagnosed with knee OA and are recommended for a knee injection. Study subjects will be randomized to receive either the standard of care knee injection (steroid) or amniotic tissue injection (BioDRestore). Study subjects will be asked for permission for a baseline knee aspiration prior to the knee injection. At 6 months post-injection, knee aspirations will be taken and sent for analysis. Study subjects will be followed for 1 year post-injection to include range of motion measurements and patient-reported pain/functional outcome measurements. X-rays will also be taken at the 1-year post-injection appointment.

primary_outcome.description: Pain assessed via Visual Analog Score (VAS).

primary_outcome.measure: Patient reported overall quality of life measures
primary_outcome.description: Quality of life assessed via Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12).
Knee function assessed via Lysholm Knee Score.
Percentage of normal for affected knee assessed via Single Assessment Numeric Evaluation (SANE).
Knee outcome measure assessed via Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS).

secondary_outcome.description: Inflammatory markers in synovial fluid of affected knee.

arm_group.description: BioDRestore™ Elemental Tissue Matrix is a morselized, flowable tissue allograft derived from amniotic tissues. 2cc will be injected in the knee joint.
Kenalog (40 mg of 40 mg/ml) will be the steroid utilized as the active comparator to be injected in the knee joint.

intervention.description: Investigational product, BioD Restore, will be injected into the articular space of the knee.
Active comparator, Kenalog steroid, will be injected into the articular space of the knee.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, aged 18 to 80 years.
- Willing and able to give voluntary informed consent to participate in this investigation.
- Patient presents with knee osteoarthritis and Kellgren Lawrence grade 2-4 (OA diagnosed and confirmed by treating physician using standing x-ray).
- Candidate for intra-articular knee injection.
- BMI < 40
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have received intra-articular injection(s) in the last 3 months.
- Patients who have undergone arthroscopic surgery on the study knee in the past year.
- Patients who have undergone arthroplasty on the study knee.
- Ligament instability
- Diabetes (Type 1 or II)
- Inflammatory arthropathies.
- Fibromyalgia or chronic fatigue syndrome.
- Female patient who is pregnant or nursing.
- Chronic use of narcotics.
- Any other reason (in the judgment of the investigator).

overall_official.affiliation: Steadman Hawkins Clinic of the Carolinas - Greenville Health System

facility.name: Steadman Hawkins Clinic of the Carolinas
